intro: Oxymeris dolichostachya, commonly known as the long-stalked oxymeris, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly found in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are typically opposite and elliptical, with a smooth surface and a slight pubescence. Oxymeris dolichostachya is often found in open woodlands and along riverbanks, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
